description.p: Among the greatest of dwarven warriors are those trained to stand unyielding against any threat. The Dwarven Defenders form the immovable bulwark at the heart of dwarven defense lines, shield in hand, braced shoulder to shoulder with their brethren. Forged in stone keeps and honed in tunnel wars, they hold the line while others fall back. Their skill with shields and steadfast nature make them legendary protectors of dwarven strongholds.
Starting when you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you can use a bonus action to initiate your Warding Formation. You may use this ability once, and regain it after a long rest.

Warding Formation. For 1 minute, you and allies within 5 feet who can see or hear you gain +2 AC if adjacent to another shield-wielding ally. Additionally, all affected gain +1 AC from their shields. This does not stack with itself.

sheet.description: You initiate your Warding Formation. For 1 minute, you and allies within 5 feet gain +2 AC if adjacent to another shield-wielder. They also gain +1 AC from their shields. Does not stack with itself.

description.p: At 7th level, your skill with warhammers, mauls, and similar weapons increases. Their damage dice increase to d8 (d10 with two hands), and you gain 10-foot reach with melee attacks. When you make an attack with one, you may use a bonus action to strike with the haft or pommel, dealing 1d4 bludgeoning damage.

sheet.description: Warhammers, mauls, and similar weapons deal d8 (or d10 two-handed). Reach increases to 10 feet. Bonus action: strike with haft for 1d4 bludgeoning damage.

description.p: At 10th level, you become adept at using your shield to guard allies. When a creature attacks an ally within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to add your proficiency bonus to their AC until your next turn. You must be wielding a shield.

sheet.description: When a creature attacks an ally within 5 feet of you, add +{{proficiency}} to their AC until your next turn. Requires shield.

description.p: At 15th level, your critical strikes come with bone-shattering force. You score a critical hit on a 19 or 20. When you do, if your target has a shield, it is knocked 10 feet away. If not, they take an additional 1d6 bludgeoning damage.

sheet.description: You crit on 19â€“20. On a melee crit, knock a shield 10 feet away or deal an extra 1d6 bludgeoning if no shield.

description.p: At 18th level, you embody the heart of the stone halls. When you take the Attack action, you may forgo one attack to make a separate melee attack against each creature within 5 feet. Roll separately for each target.

sheet.description: When you take the Attack action, you may forgo one attack to strike every creature within 5 feet with separate rolls.
